cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'` cucumber --tags @wip -f progress
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres

    Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0
        
    Scenario Outline: Only hear in-range shout
        Given Sean is at <Seans-Location>
        When Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear <What-Lucy-Hears>
        Examples: Basic Examples
          |Seans-Location|What-Lucy-Hears  |
          |0, 900        |1 shout from Sean|
          |800, 800      |nothing          |
    @wip
    Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are located at
          | name  | x    | y   |
          | Sean  | 0    | 500 |
          | Oscar | 1100 | 0   |
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Oscar
        But Lucy should hear 1 shout from Sean
        
    Scenario: Shouter should not hear their own shouts
        When Lucy shouts 
        Then Lucy should hear nothing
    
    Scenario: Multiple shouts from one person
        And Sean is at 0, 500
        When Sean shouts
        And Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean
